intro: Kennedynella tomentosa, commonly known as the woolly rock heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, hairy foliage that gives it a woolly appearance. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are usually pink or white, which bloom in spring. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
